III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
1

of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 07/26/25, There was an altercation between a staff member
and a youth. The youth spit on a staff member and the staff
member put their hands around the youth's neck.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 08/04/2025. Complainant did
not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 08/04/2025 at Wolverine Center.
Youth A stated he “barely remembers” the incident between him
and Staff 1. Youth A stated he was in the main common area
when Staff 1 walked up to him and placed her hand in the middle
of his neck. Youth A stated he and Staff 1 were standing face to
face when this occurred. Youth A was asked what happened prior
to Staff 1 walking up to him. Youth A stated he spit one time and
his spit landed on the ground next to Staff 1. Youth A stated he
was not choked and not injured in this incident. Youth A was
observed without marks or swelling to his neck. Youth A stated he
does not recall witnesses to this incident but a staff (does not
know who) separated him and Staff 1.
Youth B was interviewed on 08/04/2025 at Wolverine Center.
Youth B stated Youth A became upset for an unknown reason in
the main common area. Youth B stated Youth A used profanity,
flipped a table, and spit at Staff 1 in the main common area. Youth
B stated he heard Staff 1 say something about spit entering her
mouth and Staff 1 becoming angry. Youth B stated he did not see
anything else because he was redirected to leave the room.
Youth C was interviewed on 08/08/2025 at Wolverine Center.
Youth C stated he tried to intervene between Youth A and Staff 1
after Youth A spit on Staff 1. Youth C stated he did not recall how
Youth A and Staff 1 were positioned when he tried to intervene.
Youth C stated he left the main common area when staff (does not
recall who) redirected him to leave.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 08/14/2025 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service (DHHS)
2

Worker. Staff 1 stated Youth A returned from his outing hungry
and ate his dinner in the main common area. Staff 1 stated Youth
A was redirected for arguing with Youth C. Staff 1 stated she
redirected Youth A to relax as he picked up his Jello and threw it
at Youth C. Staff 1 stated Youth A then stood up, flipped over the
table, threw a chair and another chair at Staff 1. Staff 1 stated she
caught the second chair and set it down. Staff 1 stated the
common area was cleared of youths except Youth C remained.
Staff 1 stated Youth A began to spit as she redirected Youth A to
calm down to not lose his points. Staff 1 stated Youth A’s spit
landed in her mouth and she “charged towards” Youth A and
grabbed the front of Youth A’s shirt. Staff 1 stated Youth A did not
choke because he was calling her names. Staff 1 stated
Supervisor directed Staff 2 to intervene and redirected Youth C
not to intervene between Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 1 stated Youth
A spit on her again before Staff 2 escorted her out of the main
common area and the building. Staff 1 stated she tried for
approximately 15 minutes to get into the building to get her
belongings but left without re-entering. Staff 1 stated she has not
worked at Wolverine Center since this incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 08/08/2025 at Wolverine Center. Staff
2 stated Youth A became upset when he did not receive a soda
pop with his dinner. Staff 2 stated Youth A threw his hot dog bun,
called staff bitches, threw chairs, and spit at Staff 1. Staff 2 stated
Youth A did not respond to redirection and the main common area
was cleared of youths. Staff 2 stated Youth A and Staff 1 were
physically engaged with Youth A swinging and pushing Staff 1
while Staff 1’s arms extended on to Youth A’s upper shoulders.
Staff 2 stated he maneuvered between Youth A and Staff 1 and
escorted Staff 1 out of the room and out of the building. Staff 2
stated Staff 1 tried to get into the building for the next hour and a
half but was not allowed in. Staff 2 stated Supervisor remained in
the main common area and de-escalated Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed on 08/08/2025 at Wolverine Center.
Supervisor stated Youth A and Youth B were eating in the main
common area when they returned from their outing. Supervisor
stated Youth A became upset, threw his food off the table and
flipped over the table. Supervisor stated Youth B and other youths
were redirected to leave the room. Supervisor stated Staff 1
redirected Youth A’s behavior and Youth A spit at Staff 1 multiple
times. Supervisor stated she redirected Youth C, who remained in
the main common area, not to intervene between Youth A and
Staff 1. Supervisor stated she tried to intervene as Youth A and
Staff 1 faced each other and held onto each other’s arms.
3

Supervisor stated she directed Staff 2 to take Staff 1 out of the
room. Supervisor stated she remained in the main common area
and de-escalated Youth A. Supervisor stated Youth A did not
complain of pain or injury from this incident with Staff 1.
Video
Wolverine Center’s main common area video footage dated
07/26/2025 was reviewed starting at 6:45 PM. Video footage does
not have sound. Youth A sits at a table with his back to the wall.
Youth A throws something from the table towards the center of the
room. Youth A stands up and flips over the table. Youth A throws
a chair in Staff 1’s direction as she approaches him. Youth A picks
up another chair and throws it at Staff 1. Staff 1 catches the chair
and sets it down. Youth A and Staff 1 stand facing each other.
Supervisor walks towards Youth A and Staff 1. Youth A pushes
Staff 1. Staff 1 wipes her face with her hand. Staff 1 moves
directly in front of Youth A and places a hand at the base of Youth
A’s neck and Youth A walks backwards towards the wall. Youth C,
who remained in the main common area, walks up to Youth A and
Staff 1 and tries to intervene. Supervisor moves towards Youth C
and Youth C moves away from Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 2
physically steps between Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 2 places his
hands on Staff 1’s arms and guides Staff 1 backwards out of the
room. Supervisor remains with Youth A in the main common area.
Documentation Reviewed
07/26/2025 incident report states Youth A was not injured in this
incident between him and Staff 1.
Wolverine Center utilizes Crisis Prevention Institute (CPI) –
Nonviolent Crisis Physical Intervention. Their physical
management policy and procedure states “All non-violent physical
interventions at Wolverine Human Services will follow the
principles established by the CPI curriculum.”
Staff 1 was hired on 06/03/2024. Staff 1 completed CPI training on
06/14/2024 and 10/29/2024. Staff 1 does not have a discipline
history.
Incident Location
The main common area is located on the first floor of Wolverine
Center. The main common area is a large, rectangular room with
tables and chairs.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance when Staff 1 placed her
hand on or near Youth A’s neck on 07/26/2025. Staff 1’s physical
4

handling of this incident is not an approved CPI physical
management technique.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION

Corrective action plan approved 08/11/2025
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
